H0.text: The current flowing through the wire to the light bulb allows a light bulb to give off light.

H1.text: The light bulb giving electrical energy to the battery is what allows a light bulb to give off light.

H2.text: The light bulb generating heat energy allows a light bulb to give off light.

H3.text: The battery pushing light through the wire is what allows a light bulb to give off light.

A4.text: An incandescent light bulb produces illumination by Joule heating a filament until it glows.

A5.text: The heated filament emits light that approximates a continuous spectrum.
